info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 2 at 7:10PM CDT until August 2 at 10:15PM CDT by NWS Birmingham AL
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following counties, Cherokee and Etowah.
* WHEN...Until 1015 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 710 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1.75 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Gadsden, Hokes Bluff, Centre, Cedar Bluff, Centre Municipal Airport, Forney, Glencoe, Gaylesville, Tennala, Moshat, Western Weiss Lake, Ball Flat, Eastern Weiss Lake, Ballplay, Cornwall Furnace Park, Slackland, Coloma, Weiss Dam, Howells Crossroads and Reaves.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM CDT THIS EVENING
